intro: Tetrapterys glabra, commonly known as the smooth-leaved tetrapterys, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly in countries like Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are smooth and often have a distinctive venation pattern. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, hairy pods that contain several seeds. Tetrapterys glabra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
